question: A tiny species of this type of animal was recently discovered in Brazil. It is the second-smallest known vertebrate species in the world. These amphibians secrete a toxic substance from glands behind their eyes as a defense mechanism against predators. Often confused with frogs, they have drier, bumpier skin and shorter legs adapted for walking rather than hopping. Unlike frogs, they lay their eggs in long chains rather than clusters.  Their young undergo metamorphosis from aquatic tadpoles to terrestrial adults. What are these wart-covered creatures, often found in gardens and woodlands?

A seed storage facility in this nation, built to safeguard crop diversity, recently received more than 30,000 new samples for around the world. This country, known for its breathtaking fjords and the Northern Lights, houses a global seed vault on the island of Spitsbergen, safeguarding over a million seed samples from around the world. The vault, built deep inside a mountain, serves as a backup for global food security in the event of natural disasters or global crises. It is also home to the Nobel Peace Prize ceremony, held annually in Oslo. What is this Scandinavian country, known for its rich Viking history and stunning natural beauty?

This nation experienced deadly flooding around the city of Valencia that led the over 200 deaths. The country, home to the Sagrada Familia, a masterpiece by Antoni Gaudí that has been under construction for over a century, boasts a vibrant tradition of flamenco dancing and music. Its annual Running of the Bulls in Pamplona attracts thrill-seekers and spectators from around the world. It is also the birthplace of paella, a flavorful rice dish that has become a culinary symbol of the nation. What is this European country, known for its rich history, diverse culture, and passion for football?

This musician passed away on November 3, 2024 at the age of 91. The multi-talented artist, who arranged and conducted Michael Jackson's iconic album "Thriller," holds the record for the most Grammy Award nominations, with a staggering 80 nods throughout his illustrious career. He began his career as a trumpeter, playing with jazz legends like Lionel Hampton and Dizzy Gillespie.  He has composed scores for over 30 films, including "In the Heat of the Night" and "The Color Purple." He also produced the charity single "We Are the World," which became a global anthem for famine relief efforts. Name this legendary father of Rashida Jones.

This practice, often attributed to Benjamin Franklin's satirical essay suggesting Parisians could save money on candles by waking up earlier, was first legally mandated in Germany during World War I as a way to conserve energy.  It was later adopted by many countries, including the United States, where it was standardized in 1966 with the Uniform Time Act.  The rationale behind it is to make better use of daylight hours by shifting the clock forward during the summer months.  However, its effectiveness and impact on health and productivity remain a subject of debate.  What is this practice of adjusting the clock forward and backward throughout the year?

This technology company recently annouced they are working on a search engine powered by their artificial intelligence model Llama. The company faced scrutiny in 2023 for its controversial rebranding and investment in the metaverse, a virtual reality platform still under development. Its CEO, Mark Zuckerberg, co-founded the company in his Harvard dorm room in 2004. It owns popular social media platforms like Instagram and WhatsApp, boasting billions of users worldwide. What is the name of this tech giant, formerly known as Facebook, Inc.?

This man achieved what Donald Trump is attempting: serving 2 non-consecutive presidential terms. This president faced a major economic crisis during his second term known as the Panic of 1893. He vetoed more bills than any other president up to that point, earning him the nickname "Grover the Good." He signed the Interstate Commerce Act, which regulated railroad rates, and oversaw the dedication of the Statue of Liberty. Who was this 22nd and 24th president of the United States?
